title: Flaunt Green | Sustainable Clothing for Men & Women
description: An e-commerce website for a sustainable clothing brand including GTM for user behaviour analysis and SSR for SEO optimization.
descriptionList: An e-commerce website made for the flauntgreen team.
Features fully dynamic pages with server side rendering to optimize SEO.
Includes GTM tracking to track user behavior and patterns that help in making business decisions.
Fully responsive layout across all devices.

title: BuyBack
description: A comprehensive application designed for store executives to manage buyback of old devices, for liquidators to bid on lots of bought devices and manage delivery of those lots.
descriptionList: This was one of the most comprehensive project I've worked on.
It was designed to help a national chain of stores buy used devices back from its customers and auction them off to liquidators.
It featured dashboards for store, warehouses and liquidators to provide a complete solution to the "buyback" problem.
A great learning experience as this was my first real-life project that was going to have actual users.
Some of the features:
A QNA section that was used to analyze the condition and calculate the price  of the device.
Store level dashboard to view and manage orders, create shipments and redeem coupons.
Warehouse level dashboard to approve shipments, wipe data from devices and upload their certificate as proof, create lots for auctions.
Liquidator section from where liquidators could recharge their wallets, place bids on active auctions and compete with other liquidators.
techStack: Misc. react libraries for various utilities.

title: Rewards.Gnext
description: A multi country multi language web app designed to manage participation and distribution of a rewards program equipped with an admin panel.
descriptionList: This project was made for a multi national seller to create and manage reward schemes.
Gained over 1700 enrollments across 3 countries in a timespan of a month.
Featured internationalization to help users from other countries use the website in their native language.

title: Offer Unicorn
description: An admin panel designed to help a national chain of stores create and manage offers, collect participation and analyze user participation.
descriptionList: This project was designed to help a national chain of Apple device vendors create offers.
Users could create and manage offers, analyze user participation and behaviors.
Was used during the iPhone 16 launch period.

title: Books Palace - The perfect place to find books to read
description: Book Store app made using Next.Js to explore books extracted from books.google.com api.
descriptionList: Another small nextjs project to understand dynamic routes and data fetching on dynamic pages

title: ShopBuddy- E-Commerce template
description: An E-Commerce website created using next.js which gets data from fakestoreapi.com.
descriptionList: A small e-commerce project made to understand dynamic data fetching and nextjs routing behavior

title: FoodBuddy - Your culinary companion
description: React application to discover a vast variety of dishes and how to make them pulled from themealdb.com.
descriptionList: My first react application.
Showcases dynamic data fetching.
Dynamic routes using react-browser-router

title: Fake News Detection
description: Fake News Detection system utilizing LSTM neural network to identify and stop the spread of false news.
descriptionList: Data sourced from two datasets: real news (True.csv) and fake news (Fake.csv).
Preprocessing steps include combining title and text, removing stopwords, and tokenizing words using NLTK and Gensim libraries.
Deep Learning Model: Sequential model with an Embedding layer, Bidirectional LSTM layer, and Dense layers for classification.
Traditional ML Classifiers: Decision Tree, Passive Aggressive, Random Forest, Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, and k-Nearest Neighbors (kNN) classifiers.
Evaluation metrics used include accuracy scores and confusion matrices.
Results showed high accuracy across all models, with LSTM achieving the highest accuracy of 99.82%.
techStack: Python - (NLTK, Gensim, TensorFlow, Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Scikit-learn)

title: Attendance Monitoring System
description: A Blockchain Enabled Attendance Monitoring system that uses face recognition to mark attendance.
descriptionList: Collaborated with a 3-member team to design and implement a real-time attendance monitoring system.
Engineered a robust attendance solution, integrating advanced face recognition and blockchain technologies.
Achieved 99.38% accuracy in face recognition, enhancing reliability in attendance tracking.
Co-authored a research paper published in an IEEE journal, sharing project insights with the academic community.
